problem: We flip a fair coin 10 times.  What is the probability that we get heads in at least 8 of the 10 flips?
solution: There are $2^{10} = 1024$ possible outcomes of the 10 coin flips. The number of ways to get 8, 9, or 10 heads is $\binom{10}{8}+\binom{10}{9}+\binom{10}{10}=45+10+1=56$.  So the probability is $\dfrac{56}{1024}=\boxed{\dfrac{7}{128}}$.
model_solution:
Since we can get 8 heads, 9 heads, or 10 heads, 
P(at least 8 heads) = P(8 heads) + P(9 heads) + P(10 heads)
P(8 heads) = {10 \choose 8}(1/2)^8(1/2)^2 = 45/1024 
P(9 heads) = {10 \choose 9}(1/2)^9(1/2)^1 = 10/1024 
P(10 heads) = {10 \choose 10}(1/2)^10(1/2)^0 = 1/1024
Add P(8 heads), P(9 heads), and P(10 heads): 
P(at least 8 heads) = (45/1024) + (10/1024) + (1/1024)
(45/1024) + (10/1024) + (1/1024) = 56/1024 = 7/128
The final answer is: $\boxed{\frac{7}{128}}$
steps:
Since we can get 8 heads, 9 heads, or 10 heads, 
P(at least 8 heads) = P(8 heads) + P(9 heads) + P(10 heads)

Add P(8 heads), P(9 heads), and P(10 heads): 
P(at least 8 heads) = (45/1024) + (10/1024) + (1/1024)
full_steps:
Since we can get 8 heads, 9 heads, or 10 heads, 
P(at least 8 heads) = P(8 heads) + P(9 heads) + P(10 heads)

Add P(8 heads), P(9 heads), and P(10 heads): 
P(at least 8 heads) = (45/1024) + (10/1024) + (1/1024)
